author: Ariane Cruz
title: ‚ÄúBran Stark spent most of his storyline in a cave‚Äù: Game of Thrones Season 8 Script Was So Awful Isaac Hempstead-Wright Thought It Was a Joke From HBO Showrunners and We Don‚Äôt Blame Him
text:
The ending of Game of Thrones Season 8 will always remain in our memories as one of the most disappointing conclusions in the history of television. For eight years, fans have been rooting for the most deserving character to lead Westeros, only for someone like Bran Stark to end up becoming the ruler.
Credits: Isaac Hempstead-Wright in Game of Thrones / HBO In fact, even the actor himself didn‚Äôt believe the showrunners would do such a thing for a project they have dedicated almost a decade of their lives. He knew the audience would get dismayed ‚Äì even mad ‚Äì but he still believes it to be a fitting end.
Even Isaac Hempstead-Wright Couldn‚Äôt Believe Bran Stark Would Be King Perhaps the final season of HBO‚Äôs Game of Thrones was the most criticized of all the installments as not only the ending was anticlimactic, but it also had several production slip-ups that were beyond excuse. Apart from the fact that Emilia Clarke ‚Äôs Daenerys Targaryen would die in the hands of Kit Harington ‚Äôs Jon Snow, the next infuriating event would be the election of Isaac Hempstead-Wright ‚Äôs Bran Stark as king of Westeros.
RELATED ‚ÄúWe can get 7 more shows but we can‚Äôt redo season 8‚Äù: George R.R. Martin Makes a Game of Thrones Announcement That Will Piss Off Any Fan This surprised the viewers in a not-so-good way because Bran doesn‚Äôt seem like the type of character who would lead a kingdom or rule his people. He was incapacitated after falling off a tower, and spent most of his life stuck in a wheelchair.
Credits: Isaac Hempstead-Wright in Game of Thrones / HBO After learning that his character would eventually become the fateful king, Hempstead-Wright believed it was a jest from the showrunners. He told Entertainment Weekly how he thought ‚Äú it was a joke script and that [showrunners David Benioff and Dan Weiss] sent to everyone a script with their own character ends up on the Iron Throne .‚Äù
Well, this sounds like a good prank, though, and when you think about it, it‚Äôs a good way to protect the show from spoilers and online leaks as they will have different endings.
RELATED ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre not following my template‚Äù: George R.R. Martin‚Äôs Worst Fears About Game of Thrones Series Came True After He Predicted a Major Flaw in the Approach The decision to elect Bran as King of Westeros made a lot of fans unhappy and the 25-year-old actor is very much aware of this. A fan remarked on this about the British star and Bran‚Äôs journey in the show:
he understood bran spent most of his storyline in a cave. he was a cave dweller. should‚Äôve been the master of whispers in all honesty, he‚Äôd have ALL the tea‚Ä¶
‚Äî finnüêÆüáµüá∏ (@olrazzdazz_) August 29, 2024 It‚Äôs safe to say that fans thought he would have a more significant role in the final season as a warg and a greenseer, but it was clear that the showrunners had a different plan.
George R.R. Martin Wanted Bran Stark To Win The Game Of Thrones Credits: George R.R. Martin via CBS News Hempstead-Wright revealed that author George R.R. Martin intended Bran Stark to become king. Since the shocking news about his character, the actor didn‚Äôt believe the showrunners until he was told it was Martin‚Äôs vision all along.
In HBO‚Äôs Making Game of Thrones , the actor shared that ‚Äú there were two things [author] George R.R. Martin had planned for Bran, and that was the Hodor revelation, and that he would be king .‚Äù He was still happy to play the part despite the initial skepticism.
Game of Thrones is currently streaming on HBO.

author: Melisse Castillo
title: Alerta en Matamoros, Tamaulipas: temen posible caso de dengue hemorr√°gico en la ciudad
text:
Las autoridades de salud en Matamoros ya est√°n encendiendo los focos rojos ante el riesgo de que aparezcan m√°s casos de dengue hemorr√°gico, especialmente tras las lluvias recientes. Seg√∫n lo confirm√≥ el secretario de Salud Municipal, Antonio Alfaro Caballero, hay un paciente bajo observaci√≥n en el IMSS por posible dengue grave, con s√≠ntomas que podr√≠an derivar en complicaciones hemorr√°gicas . Aunque hasta ahora solo hay un caso de dengue grave confirmado en lo que va del a√±o ‚Äîregistrado en la semana epidemiol√≥gica n√∫mero 23‚Äî el paciente ya se encuentra fuera de peligro.
‚ÄúEstamos esperando ahorita, pasando estas aguas, reunirnos con el personal de la Tercera Jurisdicci√≥n Sanitaria para platicar y ver qu√© podemos hacer precisamente para poder contener un poquito los casos probables que puedan venir‚Äù.
Actualmente, se tienen 27 casos confirmados, y la preocupaci√≥n crece por este nuevo posible caso con signos de dengue hemorr√°gico en Matamoros.
‚ÄúQuiero comentarles que aunque no se tenga la confirmaci√≥n de ese caso, obviamente al paciente se le maneja como tal, se le trata y pues esperemos que pueda estar fuera de peligro en pocos d√≠as‚Äù.
El problema es que los contagios no se concentran en una sola zona. Seg√∫n lo discutido con el √°rea de epidemiolog√≠a, hay varios puntos de la ciudad con reportes activos . La idea es que en los pr√≥ximos d√≠as se sienten a revisar los planes y ajustar lo que sea necesario para frenar los contagios antes de que escale.
‚ÄúNosotros lo que hemos estado haciendo es precisamente en estas labores de prevenci√≥n y promoci√≥n a la salud, en las √°reas donde hay m√°s densidad poblacional, por ejemplo llevamos en toda el √°rea de Las Brisas, m√°s de una semana en el tema de eliminaci√≥n de criaderos, de descacharrizaci√≥n, ahorita estamos todav√≠a en la colonia Acuario‚Äù.
Por Jorge Capetillo

author: CJ Maclin
title: chevron-right
text: CLAREMORE, OKLA. (KTUL) ‚Äî A new organization is helping Claremore residents in the wake of the tornado that struck their town three weeks ago. It's called the Claremore and Rogers County disaster assistance. When NewsChannel 8 arrived at the interview, there was an older gentleman outside putting the pieces of his home back together with a sling on. This organization explained its process to him and assisted him without any hesitation. The same thing they are doing for the City of Claremore. ‚ÄúFor us specifically, me and my wife, we lost our camper. Everything was completely destroyed. Gone. There wasn‚Äôt anything left but the toilet and the frame. And both of our vehicles were also totaled,‚Äù said Andrew Klauditz, a Claremore resident affected by the tornado. Andrew is just one of many Claremore residents who have been helped by the Rogers County Disaster Assistance Organization after the Memorial Day tornado. Residents are continuing to pick up the pieces from what's left of their homes three weeks later. Some lost their homes in this disaster and others are trying to hold the city of Claremore together. One of those organizations is CRCDA who are providing shelter for people after they received a generous amount of aid from one local bank. ‚ÄúI only see the need in helping out a fellow citizen and getting back to their normalcy that they rightfully deserve. No one asked for a tornado to come and rip apart their life. They didn‚Äôt do anything to cause it, but we can do something to fix it. And we need the donations and funds to help that,‚Äù said team member of Claremore & Rogers disaster assistance, Kacey Alchammat. Andrew said that this organization helped his family find a new place to live on a campsite and they didn‚Äôt charge his family a dime. ‚ÄúIt was a relief. That‚Äôs something a lot of people have been asking me. You must be ecstatic, you must be excited? No, I can breathe. That‚Äôs the most important part for me at least. Is that now I can breathe.‚Äù This organization started two days after the tornado struck Claremore. They set a goal of $500,000. Right now, they‚Äôve reached 20% of that goal while receiving nearly 400 applications. The funds they receive are donor funds. On Friday, they will be presenting checks to households to start the re-building process. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a blessing to help anyone in need. When you come out here and you just see the depravity and destruction of what‚Äôs happened; and the way that people are having to live currently, said Alchammat. They're living with water leaking in their roof, people needing medical attention that can‚Äôt afford it can‚Äôt provide it.‚Äù You can donate to the Claremore & Rogers County disaster assistance organization [here](https://www.kindridgiving.com/App/Form/078d09be-cad6-4696-b29c-420936aa81b0).

author: SBT
title: MP instaura inqu√©rito para investigar prefeitura de SP por compra superfaturada de √°gua - SBT News
text: MP instaura inqu√©rito para investigar prefeitura de SP por compra superfaturada de √°gua Garrafas de √°gua sem g√°s teriam sido adquiridas por R$ 5,52, em m√©dia, no Carnaval deste ano. Prefeitura disse que vai prestar esclarecimentos O promotor Ricardo Manuel Castro, do Minist√©rio P√∫blico de S√£o Paulo, instaurou um inqu√©rito civil para apurar a suposta compra superfaturada de √°gua mineral pela prefeitura de S√£o Paulo no Carnaval de 2024. O objeto de investiga√ß√£o √© uma suspeita de que a Secretaria Municipal das Subprefeituras teria pago √† empresa AMBP Promo√ß√µes e Eventos Empresariais R$ 1.391.040,00 por 252 mil garrafas de √°gua sem g√°s de 500 ml para distribuir aos foli√µes. Na m√©dia, isso significa que cada garrafa custou R$ 5,52, o que "supera em muito o valor m√©dio da unidade de √°gua [na cidade] em R$ 1,95", segundo o promotor. A representa√ß√£o foi apresentada por vereadores do PSOL na capital paulista. Em nota enviada ao SBT News, a prefeitura afirmou que a Secretaria "recebeu o of√≠cio encaminhado pelo Minist√©rio P√∫blico e vai prestar os esclarecimentos necess√°rios no tempo devido" e refor√ßou que a licita√ß√£o para o investimento "atendeu aos requisitos legais". O que √© um inqu√©rito civil? O inqu√©rito civil √© um processo exclusivo do Minist√©rio P√∫blico, √≥rg√£o que tem como compromisso fiscalizar e demandar a investiga√ß√£o de condutas dos √≥rg√£os p√∫blicos. Dentro dessa premissa, o MP pode instaurar esse procedimento quando h√° suspeita de viola√ß√£o de direitos coletivos ‚Äì nesse caso, o objeto √© o emprego superfaturado de recursos p√∫blicos, que lesaria o contribuinte. O que acontece agora? O inqu√©rito civil n√£o tem natureza acusat√≥ria e, portanto, n√£o tornou as entidades envolvidas acusadas. Al√©m da abertura de investiga√ß√£o, o promotor determinou que a prefeitura e a AMBP prestem esclarecimentos a respeito dos eventos investigados em at√© 15 dias.

author: admin
title: Jubilee Audience cancelled as Pope Francis is treated for Bronchitis in Hospital
text:
Following the hospitalization of Pope Francis who is being treated for bronchitis at the Agostino Gemelli Polyclinic Hospital in Rome, adjustments have been made to the upcoming Jubilee events.
A Holy See Press Office statement on Friday said ‚ÄúThe Jubilee Audience scheduled for tomorrow, February 15, has been canceled. The Holy Mass for the Jubilee of Artists and the World of Culture, set to take place on Sunday, February 16, will be presided over by His Eminence Cardinal Jos√© Tolentino de Mendon√ßa, Prefect of the Dicastery for Culture and Education‚Äù.
‚ÄúFurthermore, the meeting with artists, originally planned for Monday at Cinecitt√†, will not take place due to the Pope‚Äôs inability to attend,‚Äù the statement continued.
The Holy See Press Office announced on Friday morning that Pope Francis would be admitted to the Agostino Gemelli Polyclinic hospital following his morning audiences, explaining that the Pope was scheduled to undergo several diagnostic tests and continue treatment for his ongoing bout of bronchitis.
The Holy Father has been suffering from bronchitis for several days, as he has noted during a couple of public audiences.
He has asked his collaborators to read his prepared remarks at the last two Wednesday General Audiences, among other events.
Already on February 6, the Holy See Press Office had released a statement noting that the Pope was suffering from bronchitis and would hold his audiences at his residence in the Casa Santa Marta, Vatican News writes.
